spell.name: The Log
entries: You conjure up a 5 foot wide rolling log that crashes through a 30 foot line starting at a point in range. Each grounded creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 1d10} bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone} as well as pushed 5 feet in the direction the log is travelling. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone} or pushed. The log then crumbles into nothing.
“A spilt bottle of Rage turned an innocent tree trunk into "The Log". Now, it seeks revenge by crushing anything in its path!

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Skeletons
entries: Drawing from your pool of King's Elixir, you conjure three Skeletons surrounding an unoccupied space as close to your target as possible.

A skeleton summoned by this spell falls into pieces when it drops to 0 hit points, unable to do anything. When the spell ends, or when you exit combat, the skeletons and skeleton remains melt into a puddle of King's Elixir and evaporate in an instant.
The skeletons are friendly to you and your companions. Roll initiative for the summoned skeletons as a group, which has its own turns. The group attacks hostile creatures on its turn.
The DM has the skeletons' statistics.
Four Skeletons are conjured, each wearing an ushanka. Each melee attack that hits revives a fallen skeleton comrade.
“Three fast, very weak melee fighters. Surround your enemies with this pile of bones!”
“When there's no room in Spooky Town, the dead will walk the Arena! This Evolution is a never-ending horde with each Skeleton summoning another with every attack!”
